newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Smit Trafo posts Dfl 47.1 mln loss in '95.
newsitem.headline: Smit Trafo posts Dfl 47.1 mln loss in '95.

text.p: (in millions of guilders unless otherwise stated)
Net per shr (guilders) loss 13.92 vs 3.91 profit

Note - Transformer maker Smit Transformatoren NV earlier forecast full-year 1995 profit would be lower than that of 1994. ABN AMRO owns a 58.3 percent stake in Smit Trafo, after lead-managing its October 1994 bourse flotation.

ABN AMRO acquired the Smit Trafo shares after a mojarity of investors accepted its offer to buy them back after the stock price collapsed on the back of loss warnings. When it went to the bourse Smit said it expected profits to grow in the coming years.
Smit posted a net loss of 4.4 million guilders in the first six months of 1995.
The announcement of the 1995 full-year results was postponed from August 29.
